intro: Centaurium tenuiflorum f. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring partial shade to full sun. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with two distinct colors—usually white and purple—on the same flower. The species is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
